channel.title: Posts on Projects
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Projects

item.title: Machine Learning Web App
item.description:
An analytic web application created with Python, Dash framework and libraries such as pandas, scikit-learn, plotly. It is a dashboard for a machine learning experiment. The goal is to create a binary classification model for predicting bankruptcy of companies. Model is trained on historical data and is supposed to classify new observations. Data sets contain financial rates from a given year of the forecasting period and corresponding class labels that indicate bankruptcy status after 1-5 years.
This app makes it possible to test various methods and algorithms for tasks such as model fitting, data preprocessing, model evaluation, visualization, etc. Most of the features were made with tools provided by scikit-learn and pandas libraries.
(The app is not meant for conducting real analysis. It merely demonstrates some functionalities of dash framework in an example context.)

Source code:
https://github.com/damianb1/bankruptcy-classification-dash

Video:

Screenshots:

item.title: Downloading Public Data
item.description:
Examples of downloading statistical data from LOCAL DATA BANK (BDL).
https://api.stat.gov.pl/Home/BdlApi
The data is available through REST API in XML and JSON format.

Github link: https://github.com/damianb1/public-data-download

item.title: Blackjack game with score saving
item.description:
A simple blackjack game made with the Unity engine.
Saving and viewing scores made possible through a basic Flask app.

Game: https://blackjack-game-test.herokuapp.com (loading for the first time may take a while)

Source code for the game: https://github.com/damianb1/blackjack-unity
Source code for the flask app: https://github.com/damianb1/blackjack-unity-flask

Game info: head to head with dealer, one deck, shuffling after every hand, dealer stands on 17, no insurance, no split.

Screenshots:
